title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to provide health services to veterans. The plans must meet standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and include minimum health care benefits for enrolled veterans. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to provide health services to veterans. These plans must meet standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services and include minimum health care benefits for enrolled veterans. The Secretary may establish an enrollment system for veterans in the plan, set cost-sharing requirements, and use payments received to cover costs of care and services provided under the plan. The Secretary may not operate a plan under Chapter 17 of title 38 at a Department facility unless sufficient medical care funds have been allotted to enable the provision of hospital care and medical services to veterans in need. Establishment of managed health-care plans and requirement for payment for certain services provided by Department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. These payments are similar to those made under title XVIII of the Social Security Act to other eligible managed care health plans. Managed health care plans providing care to Medicare-eligible veterans are deemed certified Medicare Choice organizations under the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to certify Department managed health care plans for Medicare payments. Medicare-eligible veterans receiving care from these plans are considered certified Medicare Choice organizations under the Social Security Act. Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for veterans receiving care from certified Department managed health care plans. This section applies to care provided after the enactment of the Act.
